content.body: It's not useful to know that it can only throw due to OOM? Is there anything else?
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: It's not useful to know that it can only throw due to OOM? Is there anything else?

content.body: Stack overflow IIRC was a big thing for our implementation
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Stack overflow IIRC was a big thing for our implementation

content.body: annevk: I'm not sure. Certainly for reading the specification, and trying to hold it together as a concept I think it's helpful. As an implementer, I'm less sure of the value (could be wrong, would welcome other opinion).
content.formatted_body: annevk: I'm not sure. Certainly for reading the specification, and trying to hold it together as a concept I think it's helpful. As an implementer, I'm less sure of the value (could be wrong, would welcome other opinion).

annevk: I'm not sure. Certainly for reading the specification, and trying to hold it together as a concept I think it's helpful. As an implementer, I'm less sure of the value (could be wrong, would welcome other opinion).

content.body: I know I definitely came into some of this with an incorrect assumption that OOM handling was something done on the web in complicated code bases-- that seems to not actually be the case though?
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I know I definitely came into some of this with an incorrect assumption that OOM handling was something done on the web in complicated code bases-- that seems to not actually be the case though?

content.body: (The concern I had/have is broken streams that originate from states 'impossible' in the specification, generated by things like OOM, or stack overflow)
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: (The concern I had/have is broken streams that originate from states 'impossible' in the specification, generated by things like OOM, or stack overflow)

content.body: Hey, I noticed setting Node.parentElement works in all browsers. But the spec says it is readonly, doesn't that mean setting it should throw. Or am I missing something?
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Hey, I noticed setting Node.parentElement works in all browsers. But the spec says it is readonly, doesn't that mean setting it should throw. Or am I missing something?

content.body: How could I get someone else interested in https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/3255  ?
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: How could I get someone else interested in https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/3255  ?

content.body:
> <@jespertheend:matrix.org> Hey, I noticed setting Node.parentElement works in all browsers. But the spec says it is readonly, doesn't that mean setting it should throw. Or am I missing something?

ah never mind, I was trying this in the inspector console, which doesn't use `"use strict"` I guess
